website_summaries.verdict: Complete button mapping options, a comfortable ergonomic design, and a wide range of customization accessories make this an excellent option for dedicated PlayStation 4 fans.
pros: Compatible with both PlayStation 4 and PC
Easily swap analog stick and D-Pad locations
Two customizable spare buttons under controller
Handy companion app for full configuration options
cons: This high-end PS4 controller is also an expensive one
Only available in a single red or black color

customer_reviews.title: Left stick already faulty...
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this controller except the D-Pad is trash. Unfortunately I have to return it already because the left stick keeps going out randomly. I expected more from Astro.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan J. Weatherhead

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The drivers won’t install on pc and despite every possible work around i can think of the controller wont work on pc. Ps4 it works fine but I bought it with the intention of mostly pc gaming im going to return this bc it clearly is to early in this new controllers life cycle to have these issues. They advertise plug and play but after it took the first plug in it asked for a reboot of the pc and hasn’t worked since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad
customer_reviews.text: This controller has pro’s and cons Pro: Nice rubber material (non slip) Easy to move the buttons around Comes with sturdy pouch for the controller Easy to customize your controller settings on pc Via wired mode buttons are very responsive and have a good solid feel to them Cons : No battery indicator when on PS4 dashboard Controller is bigger then DualShock 4 ( not good for small hands) Disconnected once in first game via wireless mode Cable for wired mode is not long Update right out of the box (easy to install though) The price Sometimes you hear a click sound when moving the analog sticks
customer_reviews.author: Fashion Queen

customer_reviews.title: It's worth your money. I would buy this over the Vantage.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from someone who has played Call of Duty since Black Ops & who has played with both the Scuf Vantage & the C40. This is the better controller by far. It took me about a month to get use to my Scuf Vantage as with the C40 it took me a couple of hours. The build quality is really nice with the whole controller wrapped in a rubberized material making it feel good in your hands. The sticks are smoother than the Vantage. You're getting what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Severe Left Stick Defect shows up after a few months on usage
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this controller. Everything about it was great and I didn't mind the fact the the PS button could not turn on the Playstation. Minor inconvenience. Unfortunately, the real issue has revealed itself a few months down the line, and it's a deal breaker: the left stick will stop responding overtime to the point where your game character will either stutter or simply stop moving while pushing forward. No amount of calibration or software reset resolves this issue. It appears to be hardware related. They should figure this out, get a hardware revision out, and do a recall to replace the left stick for those who already bought the controller.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Feels amazing, however after updating it through my pc. I hooked it to my ps4 and it crashed, It wont turn on and even if I try to reset it or try a different power cable, it wont turn on.. Broken after 30 min of unboxing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

Was hoping this would be better than a scuf but I’ll be switching back after this horrible fiasco. Sorry Astro you lost a customer. I will be buying products that are actually good from now on. I will never recommend Astro products again.

customer_reviews.title: L3 and R3 when pressed down it stays like that
customer_reviews.text: When the remote works it is by far the best remote in the market but I have to return it three times already and get a replacement because the left stick keeps going out randomly and L1 just stop functioning properly. Even when I swap the stick out it is not long before it goes bad again. All I'm trying to do is run and heal on call of duty by pressing down on L3 & L1 I expected more from Astro.. update June 29th, my REPLACEMENT HAS BEEN IN PROCESS FOR OVER 2 MONTHS NOW WITH NO UPDATE ON WHEN WILL I GET A NEW CONTROLLER.

And that isn’t even the worse part, this controller has messed up on me twice the first one was the left dpad button would not work at all, after returning it and getting a new one it was working fine but fast forward 2 months later the controller already has stick drift... something that isn’t suppose to do until after a year supposedly what was said on the video Astro released. customer_reviews.author: Marvin Espino

customer_reviews.title: Great controller but issue with thumbstick drift
customer_reviews.text: I mainly play Destiny and Destiny 2 on PS4 and I have had many issues with the thumbstick drift due to how the sprinting mechanic works. I have followed all of the solutions of resetting the deadzones, adjusting deadzones, and even swapping out the thumbstick units with new ones and they only resolve the problem for a short time and then it comes back. It is a shame since the controller otherwise seems very good quality and is very comfortable. I am keeping it incase I ever figure out a solution but currently am just using the regular PS4 controller with the newly released playstation paddle attachment.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: An Elite Controller!!
customer_reviews.text: Very Satisfied with the ASTRO Gaming C40 TR Controller. Feels amazing in my hands. The analog sticks feel super buttery smooth. It comes with a high quality case. I dont have any complaints about the controller or price. You get what you pay for. This controller, hands down, is the best in the market. It will not disappoint you. If you got the money just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: George Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money. Do NOT recommend. :(
customer_reviews.text: This controller was great for about a 2 weeks. The sticks now drift all over the place, making me nauseous af as I have to constantly try to stabilize myself to fight the sway. I tried all recommended methods to correct/improve to no avail. Such a waste of money. Thank f@uck Sony is putting out the add on to the plain old ps4 controller. I refuse to spend more money on new sticks for them to be messed up in a few days. Needless to say, I am beyond disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hernandez

Mapping only via cable is crappy as well, and using the button on back is confusing and a pain. Why can't I edit and save wirelessly? Seems like adding wireless function but literally nothing to do with it outside the connection is absurd. Really making it hard for me to love this controller. So much potential.
customer_reviews.author: TYSON

customer_reviews.title: Defective Thumbsticks
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say I will be returning this controller today. After trying EVERYTHING to fix my c40 thumbstick feedback problems, I give up. Tried... 1.hard recallibrations & fast 2.new astro thumbsticks 3. New BBC thumbsticks 4. Switching positions of modules Nothing worked. Had L3 & feedback issues wich is way too big of a problem to overlook (specially in comp gaming)
customer_reviews.author: Rene Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: Buyer's Beware

I actually really like the feel of the controller itself, which is why it's such a shame that it has to have all these issues. customer_reviews.author: OMGulay27

customer_reviews.title: Great controller. If you have the coin and are looking for top of the line, then buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this controller for a whopping 3 days. I primarily game FPS (rainbow 6 siege to be exact). In the last 2 nights I’ve seen my gameplay and accuracy increase. I remapped my left lean and right lean to the back buttons therefore I don’t have to press down on the R3/L3. What a huge difference! The trigger stops are amazing. It’s also has a good feeling to it. You can this this controller is premium. Now this is my first “professional” controller. I only wished I bought it sooner. The controller is a little on the heavy side but when you’re one shot head sniping I don’t mind.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing and Amazing Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars but after only a few months i have had drifting issues. other than that its amazing, you can map every button customize all the sensitivities, brightness, volume and vibration intensity from the C40 TR Configuration app. I will update as I deal with customer service on the replacement or fixing of the controller. Updated: The Astro customer support is super amazing and helpful they sent me replacement parts for free and when it still didn't work they had me send the controller to them for free and sent me a brand new one back and it works perfectingly. Will buy again from them when their next gen controllers come out for the new consoles
customer_reviews.author: Austin Orton

customer_reviews.title: Controllers great brand new, be prepared for stick drift
customer_reviews.text: My first controller with paddles initially loved it but found it doesn't turn on my PlayStation by pressing the PS button and there's also other ways to program the controller without a computer. 3 months in I've got major stuck drift and plugging into the computer and resetting it doesn't remove it like YouTubers claim.
customer_reviews.author: austin carpenter

customer_reviews.title: X button is “squishy” after only 3 months of occasional use
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this controller but now I noticed that the X button is semi squishy. If I press it fairly quickly, I get the feedback of the button that lets you know that it “pressed”, however if I press it in a relaxed manner, it never gives that haptic type feedback of the button “clicking” when you press it like the other three. Unfortunately, its one of the few buttons that cannot be replaced. With as expensive as this product is, I’d expect it to last longer. I’ve had many original controllers over a year and never experienced any of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moore

customer_reviews.text: I do not like how all the videos said that this would start right up, how it was the easiest thing to set up and all that crap. Well, I have been trying to get my controller to even light up and it won't even turn on so I'm packaging it up and sending it back and hopefully they will send me one that actually works. But other than that I will say that the swappable buttons worked very well with no issues and that the controller itself has a very nice feel to it and all around a good controller just Astro, please send me a good controller this time. Thank you, I hope this was helpful to someone
customer_reviews.author: David Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great controller, if you're willing to pay
customer_reviews.text: This is a great controller, on-par with with the other top elite controllers out there. Customizeable, easy to use software, feels great in the hand, etc. The issue is the price. You can get three or four regular dualshock controllers for the price of one of these. If you really want an elite controller that works with PC or PS$, this is one I would recommend if you're willing to pay the money. But for most people, this is overkill and way to expensive.

Disappointed in the life span.

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable (for shooters etc. Not fighters)
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I've had with the C40 so far is the dpad being a little too big. Since usually I play fighting games, I find that smaller dpads help a lot with buffering special moves. Not to mention it's about the size of an Xbox controller dpad (which is notorious for being bad for fighters), you may drop a lot of combos even if you have big thumbs. But for other games, it works perfectly. All in all it's a solid controller, I highly recommend it.

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, ghost inputs.
customer_reviews.text: This controller feels *amazing* to hold (even for a long time) but that's the only premium thing about it. It suffers from frequent ghost inputs (despite calibration) that hold the analog stick or button inputs too long. PC software is barebones and doesn't offer calibration configuration or battery information. This is one of the most expensive "afterthought" products by a company that I've ever purchased which is really disappointing because there's real potential with this one in an under-served premium controller market. The underside buttons and optional USB wired connectivity this controller has are not worth its issues.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for the joysticks
customer_reviews.text: Controller feels great, love the extra paddles on the bottom. The software allows for fast and easy configuration changes. My only concern is the left stick seems to be malfunctioning, started out very smooth and fluid, but after about 30 hrs it has developed a noticeable grind in it's inner workings. After some research I have learned that the sticks are the Achilles's heel. So do your research if you're looking, I have located an aftermarket fix for the stick issue and am waiting for it to be delivered. For the price I am disappointed at the quick failure but I can live with it if the aftermarket parts perform as advertised.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $200
customer_reviews.text: super disappointed as I always used astro headsets. But I like my scuf impact controller and 4ps pro way better. The shape is more comfortable and it made my gameplay better.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite controller
customer_reviews.text: It feels sturdy, button configuration is easy, I know some complain about it not being able to turn on the console from the controller, but I do not think it is a big issue.

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a better controller than this inferior brand made in China!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brand in September 2019. After 3 months the right thumb stick wore out and drift started interfering with game play. Even the C40 TR software couldn't help. Now 6 months later drift started again and when I connected it to my computer to adjust the sticks the computer didn't recognize the controller. Contacted Tech support again and surprisingly I was told my WARRANTY has expired! 7 months of owning this controller and it is no longer under warranty? WTF, this is what companies like ASTRO do to customers when their inferior products fail! Six month warranty for a $200.00 controller? Proof to me ASTRO knows their quality is substandard. Don't buy one folks, its not worth $200.

customer_reviews.title: After 1yr 2months R1 Trigger Broke
customer_reviews.text: Im an old school L1/R1 shooter. My R1 button broke around May 18, 2020 (Used since April 1-2, 2019.) My best guess is that the amount of leverage placed on top of the button finally gave out and broke the plastic inside. The d-pad and s-pad colors have faded. Joysticks are Not tension-able. Replaced R3 once cause of horrible stick drift (i usually play with max sensitivity CoD 20 and is exponentially noticeable. The software helped but eventually needed replacement.) I would not buy or recommend for a L1/R1 shooter but did enjoy the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ppl-say

customer_reviews.title: Bricked itself in a week.  No thanks.
customer_reviews.text: Bricked in literally a week. It was plugged into my PC in wired mode. Worked well for a week. Didn't play on my PC for 3 or 4 days when I came back it wouldn't turn on. Contacted support, did what they said, tried to charge it but it was still bricked. Sorry but if I should have turned it off (it was in wired mode?) and a few days of inactivity caused it to brick itself I don't want another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Some set backs but a nice controller

It also doesn't just start the PlayStation by hitting the psn button. And there's no battery meter like factory controllers. For the money I was hoping it worked just like a 50 dollar psn controller, it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: markus knows

customer_reviews.title: Best controller EVER
customer_reviews.text: This was a amazing early Father’s Day for my husband and he absolutely loved this was the controller that he was talking about for a long time so I surprised him with it and plus we have 4 boys and they love it too so I will recommend it to anyone I should of let my husband right the review it would have been very detailed and way better than mine
customer_reviews.author: Tangelita Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it ! Better than my Scuf
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller, I was missing R1,L1 first few games just the size difference I’m guessing. Download the software & adjust all your sensitivities !!! Makes a world of difference
customer_reviews.author: C.Pate

customer_reviews.title: It’s a no for me. Tension modules replaced four times in one year.
customer_reviews.text: I love and I hate this controller. The controller feels great in my hands. I love the fact that you can map the buttons and love the back paddles. I absolutely hate the fact that the tension modules break so easily. I have replaced them 4 times in one year. They are $29 each so do the math. For a $200 controller this is absolutely ridiculous. Love the controller otherwise but I just cannot give it more than two stars for the reasons mentioned. Maybe if the price included a reasonable amount of free tension modules I would recommend and reconsider my review.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey De Risio

customer_reviews.title: Terrible joysticks
customer_reviews.text: This controller plays and feels amazing with a huge flaw towards their thumb sticks. They start to drift on their own or they begin to have issues after a good while. Out of two controllers I tried both of them went bad. I will be switching to another brand of pro controller.
customer_reviews.author: shoppingsavy

customer_reviews.title: not a thin, small controller.
customer_reviews.text: this an excellent well made controller that I already had to send back to the company because it would not hold a battery charge after a week. I had problems with their wireless headphones like that as well. Props to Astro for replacing it, though it took about three weeks to get back to me. its shape is like a xbox elite controller so if you don't like those, you're out of luck. Astro, you should try to make a slimmer controller that doesn't fatigue the hands.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Pine

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Scuf. Just better all around. Build quality, button feel, grip, size, paddles, etc. Only drawbacks are PS button does not power on system and wireless requires USB fob. Update - after owning from launch - there’s an issue with the control sticks module. They glitch out causing issues with movement in games causing things like sprinting to constantly cancel in FPS games. Astro replaced the modules and sent a whole new controller. After a few weeks of play, the new modules and new controller had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: DAN

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for ruining my experience!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 star if it wasnt for the horrible faulty stick drifting or even not responding to "up/forward" input at all. I'm very disappointed in the controller I've been wanting since the very first time I seen it. Thank you for ruining my experience, also I haven't connected it to my PC yet to update the firmware, but seriously straight out the box and it's this messed up? I really want my money back because it's really no telling how much it's really screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: I will not recommend this controller to Hardcore gamers.
customer_reviews.text: The controller is very unreliable and filled with input lag on wireless and wired connection whether on pc or ps4. Also though the stick drift recalibration button is a nice feature, expect it to not work within in seconds of calibration. I have 3 of these controllers and they all experience extreme stick drift. I'd buy another controller or wait till they come out with a more refined version as Astro has done in the past. I love my A50 and A40 but Astro has dropped the ball on their first foray into competitive Gaming Controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Alexi

customer_reviews.title: Built with attention to detail
customer_reviews.text: Premium price for a premium controller. The second I held this controller, I did NOT want to ever put it down. Feels fantastic in the hand, weighty but not uncomfortably so. SOLID build quality. Response of the sticks feels more fluid than a DS4. Stick tension does NOT feel too loose, feels like the sweet spot of loose and tight. Buttons on the back may take some learning but once you get the muscle memory down, it feels second nature. The ergonomics feel so natural. Very nice controller. Would absolutely recommend to even the most serious, competitive PS4 player. ~15 hours in and no sign of stick drift. Will update if anything comes up.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Physical stick drifting problem
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this controller for Three months now. It was the best controller I have ever used. However, after 3 months the stick starts to drift so bad that I can’t even go straight with my character in a shooting game. There is a software solution to reset the drifting but unfortunately this doesn’t solve the drift I had. Once I reset, the same drift comes again. When I checked online I found that a lot of people are having the same physical stick problem. The only solution I have now is to buy another one! Unfortunately this is a very expensive controller that lasts for 3 months only.

I tried updating all firmwares nothing made it better. Also the range is limited, make sure there is no wall.

customer_reviews.author: kilted thrower

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 scuff controllers, i enjoyed them but the left joystick has failed on both. Sending them back for repair basically paid for half of this controller. I will never by another controller other than the Astro. I was so impressed with the case and packaging, by far the best controller I've ever had and i highly recommend it for anyone who can get it. Astro outdid themselves on the construction of it, feels so well balanced in your hands even though it might feel heavy just picking it up. If this review had 20 stars i would give it all 20.

product_meta.title: ASTRO Gaming C40 Tr Controller - PlayStation 4
product_meta.description:
The Astro C40 TR Controller is a fully customizable, high-quality pro controller built for the serious gamer. Durable and serviceable, the C40 TR Controller features swappable, replaceable analog stick and D-Pad modules as well as remappable rear buttons, allowing for multiple configurations and increased speed and accuracy for any playstyle and any genre. Seamless performance in wired or wireless modes with high-fidelity wireless audio. Free software to create and share custom controller profiles. With up to 12+ hours of battery life, the C40 TR Controller is made to outlast your game.

- Connect your controller to your computer using the included USB Cable or USB Wireless Transmitter
- Make sure your controller is in Wired mode if connecting via USB Cable, or in Wireless mode if connecting using the USB Wireless Transmitter.

- After you remove the faceplate and swap in the new module, please re-calibrate the controller again to avoid stick drift, unintended activations, or unresponsive modules. To re-calibrate, make sure the faceplate is secured correctly back on, then hold the program button on the back of the controller, let it vibrate once then don’t touch it for about 20-30 seconds. When re-calibration is complete the controller will vibrate again with the LED light blinking white twice. For more details please watch the video in the image gallery above on this product detail page
feature_bullets: Ready for any environment, the TR line of ASTRO Gaming products deliver Premium design and performance for every type of Gamer
Optimum rear button layout for superior ergonomics improves Precision during Critical moments. Mappability streamlines the Controller for any genre and playstyle while improving response time
Quickly and easily swap the analog stick or d-pad modules for consistently sharp performance. Setup the Controller in either offset or parallel configurations
Quickly and easily activate the trigger stops, which adjusts the throw of your triggers, to allow hair-trigger performance in most FPS titles
The C40 TR Controller delivers high fidelity game sound and voice chat in wired and wireless mode via the 3.5mm jack. Compatible with any gaming Headset
